Mass. Democratic Convention

Warren muscles challenger out of Senate race

Elizabeth Warren won the vote of 96 percent of delegates to the state Democratic convention and blocked Marisa DeFranco from the party’s primary ballot. (Globe, 5:31 p.m.)
  • Live Blog Convention updates  |  Warren: 'I'm ready'
  • Pictures Convention scenes | Patrick rallies delegates
  • Video DeFranco speaks | Video Warren gives speech
  • Joseph P. Kennedy III testifies for Warren
  • Globe poll has Warren even with Brown  |  Poll results
Opinion | Scot Lehigh

Brown should accept Warren's debate challenge

The two should follow the example set in 1996 by Bill Weld and John Kerry, who held nine high-profile debates in their epic Senate contest. (Globe)
  • Scot Lehigh: Who will run for governor in 2014?
  • Joan Vennochi: Warren needed, gave A-game speech

2012 Best Buddies Challenge

The Best Buddies Challenge: Hyannis Port, a 100-mile bike ride from Boston to Cape Cod, took place today. Take a look at scenes from the ride and "Tom Brady Football Challenge."

Advocates rally to ban shock treatment at Canton special-needs school

Dozens called for a ban on the use of electric shock at the Judge Rotenberg Educational Center, which is believed to be the only school in the country that uses the practice. (Globe)
